For **Processing of Payroll (National/City Paid)** (Service 1), the Human Resources Management Services (HRMS) submits the Abstract of Absences and Billings. The FMS Staff receives the documents (1 day), prepares the payroll/ORS/BURS/DV/JEV, and signs them. The Budget Staff obligates funds. The payroll is reviewed and signed by the Chief of Budget, Chief Accountant, and FMS Director. Finally, the LDDAP-ADA and other documents are released to the Admin Office. The total processing time is **1 Day and 4 Hours**.

For **Processing of Teaching Honorarium Payroll** (Service 2), Faculty members submit signed DTRs/Form 48, Accomplishment Reports, Honorarium Budget, Designation, and Grade Encoding Certification. The FMS Staff receives and reviews documents (1 day), computes hours, prepares the payroll, and checks tax computations. The payroll is obligated, and BURS/DV/JEV are prepared. After reviews by the In-charge of Fund 05, Chief Accountant, and FMS Director (1 day), the documents are released to the Administrative Services. The total processing time is **2 Days**.

topic: Payments to Suppliers/Contractors and Training Funding
content:
FMS handles payments for external obligations and staff development (G2G/G2B).

For **Processing of Payments to Suppliers/Contractors** (Service 3), the End-user submits the Approved Request, APP/PPMP, PO/Contract, IAR, and other bidding documents. The FMS Staff logs and reviews documents (1 hour). The Budget Staff certifies fund availability. The Procurement Service submits the PO for obligation (1 day). The End-user signs the ORS/BURS (4 hours). Property Management submits documents for DV/JEV preparation (1 day). After final reviews by the Chief Accountant and FMS Director, documents are released for payment (check or LDDAP-ADA). Total processing time is **2 Days and 5 Hours**.

For **Request Funding for Training/Seminars** (Service 4), employees submit an Approved Request, Invitation, CHED/Dean Endorsement, and Itinerary. The FMS Director approves funding (1 hour). The President issues a Special Order. FMS prepares the DV and Obligation Request (1 hour). Total processing time is **2 Hours and 5 Minutes**.

topic: TES, Tuition Refund, Student Clearance, and SOA
content:
FMS provides financial services directly to students (G2C).

**Processing of Financial Assistance to TES Grantees** (Service 5): The SAS submits the Approved Request and CHED Grantee List. FMS reviews documents, prints SOAs, and prepares the payroll (1 day). Documents are routed for signatures (1 day). Total time: **2 Days**.

**Payment of Refund of Tuition** (Service 6): Students submit a Request Letter, COR, Official Receipt, and Scholarship Certificate. FMS verifies documents (4 hours), evaluates them (5 mins), prepares the payroll/DV (2 hours), and secures signatures from officials (1 day). Checks/LDDAP are prepared and signed (20 mins). Total time: **2 Days, 6 Hours, and 30 Minutes**.

**Application for Student Clearance** (Service 7): Students present the Clearance Form. FMS checks the account and signs the form. Total time: **2 Minutes**.

**Issuance of Statement of Account (SOA)** (Service 8): Students submit a request. FMS checks the account, prints, and signs the SOA. Total time: **2 Minutes**.

topic: Consultation, Medical Certificates (OJT, Fit to Work/Play), and Permits
content:
The Medical and Dental Services (MDS) provides health care to the EARIST community (G2C/G2G).

**Regular Consultation and Check-up** (Service 1): Patients visit the clinic for assessment. Emergency cases are treated/referred (35 mins). Non-emergency cases are managed/prescribed (1 hour).

**Issuance of Medical Certificate to OJT Students** (Service 2): Students submit Chest X-ray, CBC, Urinalysis, and Drug Test results. The staff assesses the patient and signs the Fit for OJT certificate. Total time: **1 Hour**.

**Issuance of Return/Fit to Work Certificate** (Service 3): Employees submit a Medical Certificate, Lab Results, and Abstract. The Physician assesses fitness and signs the form. Total time: **2 Hours**.

**Issuance of Permit to Teach** (Service 4): Faculty submit lab results/medical certificates. The Officer assesses and signs the permit. Total time: **1 Hour**.

**Issuance of Fit to Play (Athletes)** (Service 5): Athletes submit Medical History and PE Form. The Officer issues the form. Total time: **1 Hour**.

**Issuance of Excuse Slip** (Service 6): Students present an Excuse Letter. The Officer issues the slip. Total time: **1 Hour and 10 Minutes**.

topic: Pre-Enrollment, Annual Physical Exam, and Dental Services
content:
MDS manages large-scale health assessments (G2C/G2G).

**Pre-Enrollment for First-Year Students** (Service 7): Incoming students submit a Chest X-Ray. The Officer assesses health and issues the **Fit to Enroll Form**. Total time: **1 Hour**.

**Annual Physical Examination (APE)** (Service 8): Employees undergo lab workups (X-ray, Blood Chem, Urinalysis, etc.) coordinated with a service provider (2 hours). The Officer releases results and signs the clearance (1 hour). Total time: **4 Hours and 40 Minutes**.

**Dental Check-up and Tooth Extraction** (Service 9): Clients fill out forms (30 mins). The Dentist performs the treatment/extraction (2 hours). Total time: **2 Hours and 40 Minutes**.

category: Physical Plant & General Services / Transportation Services
topic: Repair Requests and Vehicle Utilization
content:
These offices manage facility maintenance and transport (G2G).

**Request for Job Order Repair and Maintenance** (PPGS Service 1 & 2): Internal clients submit an Approved Letter Request and a copy of the damaged property. The Staff receives the request (5 mins). The Chief assigns personnel (5 mins). For repairs, the Chief schedules the job (10 mins), identifies the problem (10 mins), assembles the team (10 mins), and executes the work (time varies). The Job Order is signed upon completion (5 mins). Total time: **25-45 Minutes + Execution Time**.

**Utilization of Vehicle** (TMS Service 1): Clients submit an Approved Letter Request. The Staff receives it (2 mins). The Trip Ticket is issued/signed (2 mins). The request is forwarded (5 mins), and a Driver/Vehicle is assigned (10 mins). Total time: **19 Minutes**.

topic: Fee Collection and Check Disbursement
content:
The Cashier's Office handles all monetary transactions (G2C/G2G/G2B).

**Collection of Fees** (Services 1, 2, 3): For Enrollment, Rental, or Documents (TOR, Certification), clients present the Advisement Slip/Order of Payment/SAD Form. The Teller verifies the document (2 mins) and accepts payment/issues Official Receipt (3 mins). Total time: **5-10 Minutes**.

**Online Payment (Landbank Link.BizPortal)** (Service 4): Clients select EARIST on the portal, enter details (Student No., Amount), and pay. Confirmation is emailed to the Registrar/FMS. FMS verifies (5 mins) and issues the OR (2 mins). Total time: **3 Working Days** (for bank processing) + **8 Minutes**.

**Disbursement of Checks** (Service 6): Suppliers/Payees present ID and Authorization. The Staff verifies (2 mins), prepares the OR (10 mins), and releases the check (5 mins). Total time: **17 Minutes**.

topic: Feedback and Complaints Mechanism
content:
The EARIST ARTA Secretariat manages client feedback and complaints.

**Feedback**: Clients fill out the feedback form and drop it in the box. The Secretariat records it. Feedback requiring answers are forwarded to relevant offices (3 days response time). The answer is relayed to the client.

**Complaints**: Clients file a complaint via the drop box, email (admin_arta@earist.ph.education), or phone (02-8243-9460 Loc 103). Required info: Name of Person Complained, Incident, Evidence. The Secretariat opens the box weekly. The Administrative Officer investigates and submits a report to the Head of Agency. Feedback is given to the client.

**Contact Info**: ARTA (complaints@arta.gov.ph), PCC (8888), CCB (0908-881-6565).
